channel.description: Hi, I'm Tom Scott. These are some of the things I've made and done. They'll probably come back to haunt me in a few years' time. Published: October 16, 2023 - Duration: 04:35

This script was a nightmare to pronounce. â€¢
Written with Molly Ruhl and Gretchen McCulloch. Gretchen's podcast has an episode all about this: https://lingthusiasm.com/post/662535562508517376/lingthusiasm-episode-60-thats-the-kind-of â€¢
More Language Files: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL96C35uN7xGLDEnHuhD7CTZES3KXFnwm0

Gretchen's book BECAUSE INTERNET, all about the evolution of internet language, is available:

REFERENCES:

Pullum, G.K., & Zwicky, A.M. 1997. Licensing of prosodic features by syntactic rules: the key to auxiliary reduction.
Zwicky, A.M. 1970. Auxiliary Reduction in English. Linguistic Inquiry, 1(3), 323â€“336.
Traugott, Elizabeth Closs. 2003. â€˜Constructions in grammaticalization.â€™ In Brian D. Joseph &
Richard D. Janda (eds.) The Handbook of Historical Linguistics. Oxford: Blackwel

item.title: I finally rode the weird, curved German elevator. (03:31)
item.content:encoded:
Published: October 9, 2023 - Duration: 03:31

At the New Town Hall, the Neues Rathaus, in Hanover, there's a strange elevator where the track curves unevenly. For years, people from Germany have been emailing me about it: well, I finally visited. â–  More about the Hall: https://www.visit-hannover.com/en/Sightseeing-City-Tours/Tourist-Highlights/The-New-Town-Hall

Camera: Maximilian Unger
Producer: Viktor Sramo at Klein Aber

I'm at https://tomscott.com

and on Instagram as tomscottgo
